laazotea.indi.client

Class INDIElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.client.INDIElement
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    INDIBLOBElement, INDILightElement, INDINumberElement, INDISwitchElement, INDITextElement

    public abstract class INDIElement
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a INDI Element. The subclasses INDIBLOBElement, INDILightElement, INDINumberElement, INDISwitchElement and INDITextElement define the basic Elements that a INDI Property may contain according to the INDI protocol.

    It implements a listener mechanism to notify changes in its value.

    Version:
    1.32, February 4, 2013
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

    • Constructor Detail

      • INDIElement

        protected INDIElement(org.w3c.dom.Element xml,
           INDIProperty property)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs an instance of INDIElement. Called by its sub-classes. INDIElements are not usually directly instantiated. Usually used by INDIProperty.
        Parameters:
        xml - A XML Element <defXXX> describing the Element.
        property - The INDIProperty to which this Element belongs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the XML Element is not well formed (does not contain a name attribute).

        Adds a new listener that will be notified on this Element value changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to add.

      • removeINDIElementListener

        public void removeINDIElementListener(INDIElementListener listener)
        Removes a listener from the listeners list. This listener will no longer be notified of changes of this Element.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove.

      • setValue

        protected abstract void setValue(org.w3c.dom.Element xml)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the current value of the Element. It is assummed that the XML Element is really describing the new value for this particular Element.

        This method will notify the change of the value to the listeners.

        Parameters:
        xml - A XML Element <oneXXX> describing the Element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the xml is not well formed.

      • getDesiredValue

        public abstract java.lang.Object getDesiredValue()
        Gets the desired value of the Element.
        Returns:
        The current desiredvalue of the Element. null if it is not setted.

      • setDesiredValue

        public abstract void setDesiredValue(java.lang.Object desiredValue)
                              throws INDIValueException
        Sets the desired value of the Element to desiredValue
        Parameters:
        desiredValue - The desired value for the property.
        Throws:
        INDIValueException - if the desiredValue is not of the correct type for the Element.

      • isChanged

        public abstract boolean isChanged()
        Returns true if the desiredValue has been setted (and thus if it should be send to the Driver).
        Returns:
        true if the desiredValue has been setted. false otherwise.

      • getDefaultUIComponent

        public abstract INDIElementListener getDefaultUIComponent()
                                                   throws laazotea.indi.INDIException
        Gets a default UI component to handle the repesentation and control of this Element. The panel is registered as a listener of this Element. Please note that the UI class must implement INDIElementListener. The component will be chosen depending on the loaded UI libraries (I4JClientUI, I4JAndroid, etc). Note that a casting of the returned value must be done. If a previous UI element has been asked, it will be discarded and de-registered as listener. So, only one default UI element will be active.
        Returns:
        A UI component that handles this Element.
        Throws:
        laazotea.indi.INDIException

      • checkCorrectValue

        public abstract boolean checkCorrectValue(java.lang.Object desiredValue)
                                   throws INDIValueException
        Checks if a desired value would be correct to be applied to the Element according to its definition and limits.
        Parameters:
        desiredValue - The value to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the desiredValue would be acceptable to be applied to the element. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        INDIValueException - if the desiredValue is not correct.

      • getXMLOneElementNewValue

        protected abstract java.lang.String getXMLOneElementNewValue()
        Returns the XML code <oneXXX> representing this Element with a new desired value). The desired value is reseted.
        Returns:
        the XML code <oneXXX> representing the Element with a new value.
        See Also:
        setDesiredValue(java.lang.Object)

      • getNameAndValueAsString

        public abstract java.lang.String getNameAndValueAsString()
        Gets the name of the element and its current value
        Returns:
        a String with the name of the Element and Its Value
